Articles.Content:
Hello, 

I've been trying to fulfil some ship recovery contract, and I used a claw to grab the container around Duna. But when I returned to Kerbin's orbit, I left to Space Center and made a Savegame. When I returned to the ship later to complete the mission, when I burned retrograde in order to bring the container back to Kerbin's suface, then tryed to warp time a little bit, everything stopped turning. The ship is accelerating at its own, I can't maneuver it, I can't time warp anymore, it says "ship under acceleration", and I tryed this with other satellites in orbit, same thing, even with several other savegames, the game is ruined!!!!! Tell me it has a solution, because I searched on google, a lot of people talk about this bug but no answers!!!!

Thanks a lot

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-13T00:10:37Z" title="05/13/2015 12:10  AM" data-short="9 yr">May 13, 2015</time> by DaliPotter**

Have you tried turning it off and on again ? ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

(Seriously, I already had a similar thing, and the best way to fix it is to quit the game and launch it again, it may do the job)

Also, try validating your files through steam (assuming you use steam, I think the option is called "validate integrity of game cache") if you don't use steam then just re download it and integrate your save folder into the fresh directory.

I had a similarily crazy bug after I landed a probe with parachutes on jool (yes it was tedious as all hell even at 4x timewarp) and it glitched through the surface exploded and the mechjeb AR202 on the probe was ejected at something like 143 times the speed of light. The sun was like WEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE and then the game crashed xD. The savegame was fine but whenever I switched to that part I had to reinstall the game ^^
